p: Most universal vaccines in development aim at inducing broadly protective antibody responses, while some others focus on inducing T cell responses alternatively (Nachbagauer and Krammer 2017). In either case, the conserved immunogens of the virus need to be targeted, and the mechanism of protection mainly depends on the immunogens of choice (Nachbagauer and Krammer 2017; Asthagiri Arunkumar et al. 2019). This review will discuss the conserved antigenic regions/epitopes of influenza viruses that can facilitate immunogen design and contribute to the development of universal influenza vaccines.
